programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An amateur opera company is in the middle of rehearsals when a dead body is found in the theatre.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby must step into the spiritual world of mediums, psychics, and occult followers to find a killer.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: This special documentary examines Inspector Barnaby - his methods and techniques of investigation, from his time in the original novels through his translation to television.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A writers' circle are about to witness a sequence of gruesome events far stranger than any fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The peace of Ferne Basset is shattered when the body of quiet animal lover Agnes Gray is bludgeoned to death and found floating in the nearby river. The case is far from easy, when her cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat on stage during the final act of a production of Amadeus. Many of the village and of the Causton Amateur Dramatics' Society loathed him.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The villagers of Morton Fendle are up in arms when they discover the local craft centre, which they had invested in, is in financial uncertainty. As Barnaby tries to stop matters from escalating, he soon learns that its owner Alan Hollingsworth's wife Simone has been kidnapped. Shortly after following Alan to the nearby market town, and witnessing him dropping off a valise, a neighbor of his is murdered when her car is forced off the road and collides with a stationary log lorry.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a New Age commune called the 'Lodge of the Golden Windhorse', dies after falling down the stairs and breaking his neck. Barnaby and Troy arrive to investigate and meet many of the commune's quirky residents. They need to work out whether it was just an unfortunate accident or murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Emily Simpson is found dead in her house, DCI Barnaby's instincts all lead him to suspect murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.sub-title: The Village That Rose From The Dead
programme.desc: When a young man is found murdered during its grand reopening, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter must unravel a sinister web of lies from both past and present in order to catch the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Bleakridge Watch patrols the streets of their remote village, exposing anyone who steps outside the law.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a star cricketer dies during a tournament, DCI Barnaby and DS Winters investigation draws them into a dangerous game with a surprise visitor from Barnabys past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover a dead body covered in live rabbits, it reveals a sinister side to the local pet show. Is this a rivalry taken too far or is the killer driven by something darker?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young girl slips away from a Jane Austen weekend dressed in period attire, and is found stabbed in the woods, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter need to look back in time to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Winter's investigations lead them deep into a world haunted by a potentially deadly curse.
